Eyeglasses or Contacts: Which to Choose?

Eyeglasses or Contacts: Which to Choose?

  • Eyeglasses Constantly Slipping Down Your Nose? Consider These Repairs

    27 November 2018

    One of the most important details concerning your glasses is that they need to be comfortable to wear. A common complaint from many patients who wear glasses is that the glasses constantly slip, causing the patient to have to frequently push them back up their nose. Here are a few repairs that can help your glasses stay where they are supposed to be.  1. Adjust the Fit of Your Frame

  • Addressing Your Concerns About Undergoing Lasik Surgery

    16 April 2018

    If you have vision issues, there are a number of options that you will have for correcting this problem. While you might assume that these options will always involve corrective lenses, there are laser surgery options that may be able to address the underlying cause of the vision issues. How Is Lasik Surgery Done? A common cause of vision issues is slight deformities in the shape of the patient's eyes. When this is the case, the way that the light enters the eye will be impacted, and this can reduce the patient's visual acuity.

  • 2 Things To Consider When Selecting Prescription Sunglasses

    23 January 2018

    If you are living with vision impairment, you may wear eyeglasses or contacts to help you see. Unfortunately, many people who wear prescription eyeglasses will remove them when outside or driving during the daylight hours because they need to wear sunglasses. While helpful for protecting your eyes from the sunlight, traditional sunglasses will not help with your vision issue. Therefore, it is beneficial to invest in a pair of prescription sunglasses.

  • Great Reasons To Purchase Your Teenager Contacts For Their Vision Correction

    8 September 2017

    If you have a child who needs vision correction, it is very important that they get the eye wear that they need to actually improve their vision. With vision correction, they are not only going to do much better in school, but they will be able to do all of the things that teenagers look forward to, such as driving. One big decision that you and your teenager need to make together when it comes to their vision correction is what kind of eye wear you choose.

  • Home Improvement Projects: Four Lens Coatings Ideal For Protection & Clear Visuals

    17 October 2016

    Completing home improvement projects is very fulfilling and allows you to turn your home into a personal design that fits your interests and aesthetics. If you wear glasses, then there are many aspects of a home improvement project that can interfere with your visuals. Instead of working without your glasses or suffering through various visual issues, you can seek the services of an optometrist to help you select a pair of glasses that work well with your home improvement needs.

    • ««
    • «
    • 1
    • 2
    • »
    • »»

    About Me

    Since I was a teenager, I've worn eyeglasses. The idea of getting contacts didn't seem all that important. It was only during my last eye exam with a new optometrist that I decided to revisit the possibility. On the advice of my optometrist, I decided to try the disposable lenses. To my surprise, they worked great. Even my field of vision was broader. One of my favorite things is that I never have to hunt for a handkerchief or a tissue to wipe away dust from the glasses anymore. Being able to purchase sunglasses off the rack is pretty great too. If you just got the word that corrective lenses is in your future, let's talk. I'll tell you why choosing contact lenses over glasses makes sense.

    2018 Eyeglasses or Contacts: Which to Choose?
